title: Avenir-esque sans
content:
Looking for this typeface, which is very Avenir-esque, but a tad more towards Univers?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113114/http:/typophile.com/files/image_20.jpg) | 186.01 KB |
author: sondre m

comments.content: No, sorry, it’s not. [Neuzeit Office](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113114/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neuzeit-office/) should be the one. But Graphik is a great typeface, too, and a recommendable alternative.
Wow, thank you! I love Graphic! Really the best of all worlds. Is it well spaced for body? (I'll take the liberty of asking here since it seems like you know it).

Glad to help :-)

Graphik is not a typeface that invites extended reading, but I haven’t noticed anything about the spacing that put me off. You could use it for shorter accompanying texts without running into trouble, I think. If you are uncertain, have a look at the very extensive specimen on the Commercial Type website.
